New Records: Virat Kohli broke Sachin Tendulkar’s record of 49 ODI centuries by scoring his 50th century in the format
Mohammed Shami took seven wickets in the match
Shreyas Iyer scored a century with eight sixes
Key Match Events: India set a target of 398 runs in the semifinal
New Zealand's chase was disrupted early
Virat Kohli scored the fastest 50th ODI century in 106 balls
Pre-Game Insights: India were favored with a home advantage
Captain Rohit Sharma emphasized the need to stay focused
Post-Match Reflections: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the team
Mohammed Shami was praised for his bowling performance
Rohit Sharma highlighted the importance of the win for team morale
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai
Shami’s performance was crucial in securing the win
New Zealand’s fightback was led by Daryl Mitchell and Kane Williamson
Others: No score is enough at Wankhede, as per Rohit Sharma’s comment
